2 import cv2

4 IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS = 200

6 # TODO: refactor this module to optimize performances in images processing

9 def extract_img_markers(img, workspace_ratio):
10  """
11  Extract working area from an image thanks to 4 Niryo's markers
12  :param img: OpenCV image which contain 4 Niryo's markers
13  :param workspace_ratio: Ratio between the width and the height of the area represented by the markers
14  :return: extracted and warped working area image
15  """
16 
17  gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
18 
19  img_thresh = cv2.adaptiveThreshold(gray,
20  maxValue=255,
21  adaptiveMethod=cv2.ADAPTIVE_THRESH_MEAN_C,
22  thresholdType=cv2.THRESH_BINARY,
23  blockSize=15,
24  C=25)
25 
26  list_good_candidates = find_markers_from_img_thresh(img_thresh)
27  if not list_good_candidates or len(list_good_candidates) > 6:
28  return None
29 
30  if len(list_good_candidates) == 4:
31  list_good_candidates = sort_markers_detection(list_good_candidates)
32  else:
33  list_good_candidates = complicated_sort_markers(list_good_candidates, workspace_ratio=workspace_ratio)
34  if list_good_candidates is None:
35  return None
36 
37  im_cut = extract_sub_img(img, list_good_candidates, ratio_w_h=workspace_ratio)
38  return im_cut
39 
40 
41 def extract_sub_img(img, list_corners, ratio_w_h=1.0):
42  """
43  Extract an small image from a big one using a Perspective Warp
44  :param img: Big image from which the small one will be extracted
45  :param list_corners: corners list of the small image
46  :param ratio_w_h: Width over Height ratio of the area. It helps to not stretch the working area image
47  :return: extracted and warped image
48  """
49  if list_corners is None or len(list_corners) != 4:
50  return None
51 
52  if ratio_w_h >= 1.0:
53  target_w_area = int(round(ratio_w_h * IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS))
54  target_h_area = IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS
55  else:
56  ratio_w_h = 1.0 / ratio_w_h
57  target_h_area = int(round(ratio_w_h * IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS))
58  target_w_area = IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS
59 
60  points_grid = []
61 
62  for marker in list_corners:
63  points_grid.append(marker.get_center())
64  points_grid = np.array(points_grid, dtype=np.float32)
65  final_pts = np.array(
66  [[0, 0], [target_w_area - 1, 0], [target_w_area - 1, target_h_area - 1], [0, target_h_area - 1]],
67  dtype=np.float32)
68  transfo_matrix = cv2.getPerspectiveTransform(points_grid, final_pts)
69  area_im = cv2.warpPerspective(img, transfo_matrix, (target_w_area, target_h_area))
70  return area_im
71 
72 
73 def draw_markers(img, workspace_ratio=1.0):
74  gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
75 
76  img_thresh = cv2.adaptiveThreshold(gray,
77  maxValue=255,
78  adaptiveMethod=cv2.ADAPTIVE_THRESH_MEAN_C,
79  thresholdType=cv2.THRESH_BINARY,
80  blockSize=15,
81  C=32)
82 
83  list_good_candidates = find_markers_from_img_thresh(img_thresh)
84  if not list_good_candidates:
85  return False, img
86  for marker in list_good_candidates:
87  cx, cy = marker.get_center()
88  radius = marker.get_radius()
89  cv2.circle(img, (cx, cy), radius, (0, 0, 255), 2)
90  if len(list_good_candidates) > 6:
91  return False, img
92 
93  if len(list_good_candidates) == 4:
94  list_good_candidates = sort_markers_detection(list_good_candidates)
95  else:
96  list_good_candidates = complicated_sort_markers(list_good_candidates, workspace_ratio=workspace_ratio)
97  if list_good_candidates is None:
98  return False, img
99 
100  for i, marker in enumerate(list_good_candidates[:4]):
101  cx, cy = marker.get_center()
102  radius = marker.get_radius()
103  cv2.circle(img, (cx, cy), radius, (0, 200, 0), 2)
104  cv2.putText(img, "{}".format(i + 1), (cx + 5, cy - 15), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.9, (0, 0, 0), 3)
105  cv2.putText(img, "{}".format(i + 1), (cx + 5, cy - 15), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.9, (0, 200, 0), 2)
106  return True, img

109 class PotentialMarker:
110 
111  def __init__(self, center, radius, cnt):
112  self.center = center
113  self.x = center[0]
114  self.y = center[1]
115  self.radius = radius
116  self.contour = cnt
117  self.is_merged = False
118 
119  def get_center(self):
120  return self.center
121 
122  def __str__(self):
123  return "{} - {} - {}".format(self.x, self.y, self.radius)
124 
125  def __repr__(self):
126  return self.__str__()
127 
128 
129 class Marker:
130 
131  def __init__(self, potential_marker):
132  self.list_centers = [potential_marker.get_center()]
133  self.list_radius = [potential_marker.radius]
134  self.list_contours = [potential_marker.contour]
135  self.cx = self.list_centers[0][0]
136  self.cy = self.list_centers[0][1]
137  self.radius = potential_marker.radius
138  self.identifiant = None
139  self.value_for_id = None
140 
141  def get_radius(self):
142  return self.radius
143 
144  def get_center(self):
145  return self.cx, self.cy
146 
147  def add_circle(self, obj_potential_marker):
148  self.list_centers.append(obj_potential_marker.get_center())
149  self.list_radius.append(obj_potential_marker.radius)
150  obj_potential_marker.is_merged = True
151 
152  (x, y) = np.mean(self.list_centers, axis=0)
153  self.cx, self.cy = int(round(x)), int(round(y))
154 
155  self.radius = int(round(max(self.list_radius)))
156 
157  def nb_circles(self):
158  return len(self.list_centers)
159 
160  def get_id_from_slice(self, img_thresh):
161  x, y, w, h = self.cx - 1, self.cy - 1, 3, 3
162  self.value_for_id = np.mean(img_thresh[y:y + h, x:x + w])
163  if self.value_for_id > 200:
164  self.identifiant = "A"
165  else:
166  self.identifiant = "B"
167 
168  return self.identifiant
169 
170  def __str__(self):
171  return "{} - {}".format(self.nb_circles(), self.list_centers)
172 
173  def __repr__(self):
174  return self.__str__()
175 
176 
177 def sort_markers_detection(list_markers):
178 
179  def rotate_list(list_, n):
180  return list_[n:] + list_[:n]
181 
182  list_sort_y = sorted(list_markers, key=lambda m: m.cy)
183 
184  top1, top2, bottom1, bottom2 = list_sort_y
185 
186  if top1.cx < top2.cx:
187  top_left = top1
188  top_right = top2
189  else:
190  top_left = top2
191  top_right = top1
192 
193  if bottom1.cx < bottom2.cx:
194  bottom_left = bottom1
195  bottom_right = bottom2
196  else:
197  bottom_left = bottom2
198  bottom_right = bottom1
199 
200  list_markers_unsorted = [top_left, top_right, bottom_right, bottom_left]
201  list_id = [marker.identifiant for marker in list_markers_unsorted]
202 
203  if list_id.count("A") == 1:
204  list_corners_sorted = rotate_list(list_markers_unsorted, n=list_id.index("A"))
205  elif list_id.count("B") == 1:
206  list_corners_sorted = rotate_list(list_markers_unsorted, n=list_id.index("B"))
207  else:
208  return list_markers_unsorted
209 
210  return list_corners_sorted
211 
212 
213 def complicated_sort_markers(list_markers, workspace_ratio):
214  import itertools
215 
216  if workspace_ratio >= 1.0:
217  target_w_area = int(round(workspace_ratio * 200))
218  target_h_area = 200
219  else:
220  ratio_w_h = 1.0 / workspace_ratio
221  target_h_area = int(round(ratio_w_h * 200))
222  target_w_area = 200
223  list_id = [marker.identifiant for marker in list_markers]
224  count_type_a = list_id.count("A")
225  count_type_b = list_id.count("B")
226  if count_type_a < 3 > count_type_b:
227  return None
228  if count_type_a < count_type_b:
229  id_first_marker = "A"
230  id_second_marker = "B"
231  else:
232  id_first_marker = "B"
233  id_second_marker = "A"
234  list_combinaisons = []
235  list_marker_1 = [marker for marker in list_markers if marker.identifiant == id_first_marker]
236  list_marker_2 = [marker for marker in list_markers if marker.identifiant == id_second_marker]
237  if list_marker_1:
238  list_combinaisons_marker_2 = itertools.combinations(list_marker_2, 3)
239  for marker1 in list_marker_1:
240  for combi_markers2 in list_combinaisons_marker_2:
241  combin = [marker1] + list(combi_markers2)
242 
243  list_combinaisons.append(sort_markers_detection(combin))
244  else:
245  for combinaison in itertools.combinations(list_marker_2, 4):
246  list_combinaisons.append(combinaison)
247  if not list_combinaisons:
248  return None
249 
250  final_pts = np.array(
251  [[0, 0], [target_w_area - 1, 0], [target_w_area - 1, target_h_area - 1], [0, target_h_area - 1]],
252  dtype=np.float32)
253  list_det_transfo_matrix = []
254  for combin in list_combinaisons:
255  points_grid = np.array([[mark.cx, mark.cy] for mark in combin], dtype=np.float32)
256 
257  transfo_matrix = cv2.getPerspectiveTransform(points_grid, final_pts)
258  list_det_transfo_matrix.append(np.linalg.det(transfo_matrix))
259 
260  best_combin_ind = np.argmin(abs(np.array(list_det_transfo_matrix) - 1))
261  best_markers = list_combinaisons[best_combin_ind]
262  return best_markers
263 
264 
265 def find_markers_from_img_thresh(img_thresh,
266  max_dist_between_centers=3,
267  min_radius_circle=4,
268  max_radius_circle=35,
269  min_radius_marker=7):
270  contours = cv2.findContours(img_thresh, cv2.RETR_LIST, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)[-2]
271  list_potential_markers = []
272  for cnt in contours:
273  (x, y), radius = cv2.minEnclosingCircle(cnt)
274  if not min_radius_circle < radius < max_radius_circle:
275  continue
276  center = (int(round(x)), int(round(y)))
277  radius = int(radius)
278  list_potential_markers.append(PotentialMarker(center, radius, cnt))
279 
280  list_potential_markers = sorted(list_potential_markers, key=lambda m: m.x)
281  list_good_candidates = []
282 
283  for i, potential_marker in enumerate(list_potential_markers):
284  if potential_marker.is_merged:
285  continue
286  marker1 = Marker(potential_marker)
287  center_marker = marker1.get_center()
288 
289  for potential_marker2 in list_potential_markers[i + 1:]:
290  if potential_marker.is_merged:
291  continue
292  center_potential = potential_marker2.get_center()
293  if center_potential[0] - center_marker[0] > max_dist_between_centers:
294  break
295 
296  dist = np.sqrt((float(center_marker[0]) - float(center_potential[0]))**2 +
297  (float(center_marker[1]) - float(center_potential[1]))**2)
298 
299  if dist <= max_dist_between_centers:
300  marker1.add_circle(potential_marker2)
301  center_marker = marker1.get_center()
302 
303  if marker1.nb_circles() > 2 and marker1.radius >= min_radius_marker:
304  list_good_candidates.append(marker1)
305  marker1.get_id_from_slice(img_thresh)
306 
307  return list_good_candidates
